item.title: Network programming
item.description: Computer networking 101 The point of a network is to send data between machines. The nodes of the network are physical devices like computers or printers. The connection between them can be wired, for example Ethernet cables, or wireless, like WiFi. Each physical node has a network interface card, a piece of hardware that can translate between digital data and the signals sent over the network. Since the operating system controls access to hardware, it controls the network interface.

item.title: Climate change reloaded
item.description: When I first learned about climate change, there was plenty of uncertainty and time. It was one of many problems. And it was easy to ignore. Now the game has changed. Here are my main takeaways from studying the current climate landscape at Terra.do. Don’t take them as hard facts, but as an invitation to reconsider and update what you understand and think about climate change. It’s serious. Climate change is happening.
